channel.title: v8 on Kitson P. Kelly Blog
channel.description: Recent content in v8 on Kitson P. Kelly Blog

item.title: Experiments with Deno
item.description: I saw the following tweet from Mohsen: Creator of Node.js has something cooking here: This is basically Node.js with libuv (and more) swapped with Go IO and network bindings. It has native @typescriptlang support and has a new/better module system https://t.co/oVRlX8vluf — Mohsen Azimi (@mohsen____) May 30, 2018 And I got excited. While a TypeScript runtime was never an objective or goal of TypeScript, there is an argument that having a runtime, especially for a server side application, is better.
